subject: RE: Pip | Cancellation Form | Deliverability Issue

Hi Sreetheran,

Thank you for the update!

Just confirming everything looks good on our end now. 😊
Here’s a quick summary:
  • All DNS records have verified successfully
  • MailerSend is now fully connected through WP Mail SMTP
  • Form notification emails should start sending normally moving forward

Always happy to help

Hi Allie,

I have been given confirmation that the records have been added to the DNS.

Thanks.

Sreetheran Nair Technical Lead



hello@pipinsurance.com.au



0863817102

If you have received this email in error, please notify us immediately by Telephone or Email, and then destroy the mail and any attachments or documents.

Hi Sreetheran,

Thanks so much for the update.

I had another look through the logs, but unfortunately I wasn’t able to trace exactly when or why WP Mail SMTP became inactive, my apologies about that.

The good news is that everything is stable now, and this shouldn’t affect the transition moving forward.

Just to clarify:
  • We will still be using WP Mail SMTP,
  • But the mailer inside it will be switched to MailerSend
  • This setup is completely fine and will work smoothly once the DNS records are verified

Here are the DNS records you may share with your IT team:
TXT Record
Host: pipinsurance.com.au
Value: v=spf1 include:_spf.mailersend.net include:spf.protection.outlook.com -all

CNAME Record
Host: mlsend2._domainkey.pipinsurance.com.au
Points to: mlsend2._domainkey.mailersend.net

CNAME Record
Host: mta
Points to: mailersend.net

Once these are added, just let us know and we’ll verify everything on our end.

Always happy to help!

Hi Allie,

Thanks for that.

Is there a way to know why WP Mail SMTP is inactive or when it was made inactive? We want to make sure this does not happen again when we move to MailerSend.

Will you be removing WP Mail SMTP when you change it to MailerSend?

To answer your question, please do continue with MailerSend and let me know the DNS information. I will forward it to our IT team.

Thanks again.

Sreetheran Nair Technical Lead



hello@pipinsurance.com.au



0863817102

Hi Sreetheran and Megs,

Thank you so much for all the detail and screenshots, that’s really helpful.

From what I can see, the forms are still correctly capturing entries in Gravity Forms, but the notification emails are running into a deliverability issue rather than the forms “not working.”

The inactive SMTP plugin plus the behaviour you’re seeing can be pointed to an email delivery / filtering issue.

If you’re open to it, our recommendation is to connect the website to MailerSend so all form notifications are sent via a dedicated, authenticated SMTP service. Once you confirm you’re happy with this approach, I can:
  • Configure the site to send form emails via MailerSend
  • Send through the DNS records (SPF/DKIM) needed so your IT / DNS manager can verify the domain
  • Run tests on the key forms (Enquire Online, Cancellation Form, general contact, etc.) and confirm everything is delivering as expected

In the meantime, all submissions are stored safely in Gravity Forms. We can export the entries from 2/12 onwards so you have a list of affected customers (including their email addresses) to follow up with directly.

Please let me know:
  • If you’re happy for us to proceed with the MailerSend setup, and
  • Who is the best contact to send the DNS records to for pipinsurance.com.au.

Happy to help get this sorted as quickly as possible.

Hello team,

Some extra info: The timing seems closely aligned to the Gravity Forms license renewing (see attached), however the payment went off without issue and the license key looked to be the same.

Just sharing in case it's helpful, I logged into the Gravity account to triple check.

License:
6197cd316c486b358ba7e9e8c497520f

Megs Hollis Marketing Manager

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Allie Borcena

full_threads.body:
Hi Team,


We have noticed that our WordPress system has stopped sending emails from our Gravity forms.
As per the discussion below, it looks like there were forms submitted that hasn't been emailed to our email account.
I checked a couple of the forms we have, and it looks like we haven't received emails from the following forms:


  1. Enquire online. Last email received on 2/12 as stated below. There are 10 items since then that hasn't been received.
  2. Cancellation Form. Last email received on 3/12 as stated below. There are 60 entries after this date.


Has there been any changes that is causing emails to be not sent? We have noticed one of the plugins for SMTP is installed by not activated.



Could this be the problem? Is there a way to know when a plugin has been changed?


Thanks for any assistance.



Sreetheran Nair
 Technical Lead

Sreetheran.Nair@theproplab.com.au

0863817102

From: Sam Smith <Sam.Smith@pipinsurance.com.au>
Sent: Wednesday, December 10, 2025 5:45 AM
To: Tim Morgan <Tim.Morgan@theproplab.com.au>; Megs Hollis <megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au>
Cc: Sreetheran Nair <Sreetheran.Nair@theproplab.com.au>; Divyani Nagpal <Divyani.Nagpal@theproplab.com.au>
Subject: RE: Pip | Cancellation Form | Deliverability Issue


Hi Tim

There is the general contact form, request for brochure form, PM registration form in addition to the Cancellation form.



We last received a general enquiry was on on 2/12 and the last cancellation form was Wednesday, 3/12 about 10.30am AEST.


Please let me know next steps to investigate/resolve.

Is there any way we may have captured the data of customers using this form over the last week? Even just emails so we can communicate with them.



Kind regards




Sam Smith
 National Customer Service Manager

0457 763 787

From: Tim Morgan <Tim.Morgan@theproplab.com.au>
Sent: 09 December 2025 18:53

Cc: Sreetheran Nair <Sreetheran.Nair@theproplab.com.au>; Divyani Nagpal <Divyani.Nagpal@theproplab.com.au>
Subject: RE: Pip | Cancellation Form | Deliverability Issue



Hi Team,


A few questions:


  • When did it last work?
  • Are any other emails sent from the website?
  • Who manages the wordpress plug-ins?


Additionally, upon quick review…


  • We have a 'Gravity Basic' license that does not include the ability to send email natively
  • Mailchimp is connected to Gravity though it seems does not support our use case

  • 'Gravity Basic' thus relies on the Wordpress configuration to send the emails. Reviewing the plug-ins installed on the site, we do have 'WP Mail SMTP' though it is currently inactivated.





Kind Regards,


Tim Morgan
 Head of Technology & Transformation

Tim.Morgan@theproplab.com.au

+61 416 277 233

From: Megs Hollis <megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au>
Sent: Tuesday, 9 December 2025 4:52 PM
To: Sam Smith <Sam.Smith@pipinsurance.com.au>; Tim Morgan <Tim.Morgan@theproplab.com.au>
Subject: Pip | Cancellation Form | Deliverability Issue



Hello Sam!


I have taken a look at the Cancellation form issue in the Pip website settings, there haven't been any changes to the form from a Wordpress site.


What I did try is adding a personal email in the "send to" field and the confirmation/notification mail came through straight away. It didn't come through when I added my work mail as a test.


So it appears to be a deliverability issue rather than the website not working (i.e. The notification gets deployed immediately but doesn't make through our firewall / or some other cyber reason).


@Tim Morgan - would Envest be best poised to investigate this?







Megs Hollis
 Marketing Manager

megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au
